sub_title: Researcher, University of Amsterdam // Ex-TRA project (Experimenting with City Streets to Transform Urban Mobility)
summary:
Hi! I’m a researcher/consultant with 8 years of experience in the field of urban studies. After moving to the Netherlands from Kentucky in 2012, I started doing what I love and do best: researching the very real challenges facing our cities. My expertises include bridging the gap between bottom-up and top-down processes, place branding and social innovation, and more recently, sustainability transitions and experimenting with city streets to transform urban mobility. 

This path has included its fair share of roles and allowed me to work with and for a variety of different organizations and people. My door is always open - let’s get in touch!

education.field_of_study: Teaching English as a Second or Foreign Language/ESL Language Instructor

awards.title: Tau Sigma Delta Architecture National Honors Society
Gaines Fellowship in the Humanities
awards.description: A two-year fellowship/scholarship program devoted to cultivating an interest in the humanities through active participation by its fellows in both the university and the community. Fellows complete a project for their community during the junior year and an undergraduate thesis on the subject of their choice in their senior year.

projects.title: Bonding and Bridging: Connecting 'Do-it-Yourself' Urbanism and Formal Planning Practices Through Social Capital: Insights from Amsterdam and London
projects.description:
1 1/2 year, independent enthonograephic study of two 'do-it-yourself' urbanism initiatives, a group of skateboarders and a collective of squatters, in London and Amsterdam. Examined the extent to which these communities' internal organization affects the ability of self-organized citizen groups to connect with and influence formal institutions. 

Made use of qualitative research methods, primarily semi-structured interviewing and analysis of policy documents.

contributors.headline: Researcher, University of Amsterdam // Ex-TRA project (Experimenting with City Streets to Transform Urban Mobility)

projects.title: Metropolitan Landscape
projects.description: The Dutch cities are closely linked to the delta landscape by trade routes, intensive agriculture, water management, energy production, man-made 'nature' and recreation. On the one hand, the concentration of so many land uses and eco-system-services on such a small territory is an increasing challenge, especially in the light of climate change and the energy transition. On the other hand, the metropolitan landscape is a great asset of Quality of Life, which could be better used in the international competition for talent and investments.

contributors.headline: Researcher, University of Amsterdam // Ex-TRA project (Experimenting with City Streets to Transform Urban Mobility)
Spatial analysis and planning with an economics twist

projects.title: Pilot Project: UrDNA
projects.description: Subsidy project of 10,000 euros in cooperation with the national program 'Aan de Slag met de Omgevingswet' aimed at preparing citizens and local governments for the upcoming transition in urban planning. The UrDNA project aimed to bring citizens and civil servants in the municipality of Alphen aan den Rijn closer together through interactive screens placed in neighborhoods. Passerby's answered subjective questions about their neighborhood, such as 'do you feel safe here?'. The data was collected, analyzed and sent to local officials for a quick turnover in policy making decisions.

projects.title: Who Makes The City? Global Comparisons
projects.description:
One day symposium organized by students from the Research Master Urban Studies. 

I was specifically responsible for designing marketing materials, organizing the theme and content of the symposium and leading a 15 person workshop on the day of the event.

projects.title: (Re) Making Cities | 2012 International Architecture Biennale Rotterdam
projects.description: Design research project in my hometown of Paducah, Kentucky concerned with the Paducah Gaseous Diffusion Plant and potential ways to address and clean up the 10 square mile underground plume of contaminants that has been spreading for decades as a result of poor maintenance on the site. Sponsored by Department of Energy funds, our research team spent 36 months investigating how Paducah might turn this “problem” into solutions for building a prosperous future. The project deliverable took the form of several interactive models, and an exhibition of PGDP’s alternative futures, which traveled throughout Kentucky and was included in the 2012 International Architecture Biennale Rotterdam.

authors.headline: Researcher, University of Amsterdam // Ex-TRA project (Experimenting with City Streets to Transform Urban Mobility)

profile_positions.description: My research is concerned with the transitional capacity of city street experiments to cause systemic change in urban mobility. It is part of a larger European project involving universities, local governments and experts in the field of urban mobility. We are funded by EN-UAC Urban Accessibility and Connectivity.
profile_positions.title: PHD Researcher

profile_positions.description: This project aims to understand how city street experiments – defined as intentional, temporary changes to street use, regulation and/or form - can trigger a transition towards less motorized transport within the urban mobility system, ultimately creating more space for other forms of transport and increased use of streets as public spaces. The project is embedded within the EIT Urban Mobility, a program supported by the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT). It's contributions will include the development and implementation of a common experimentation framework and enabling learning and capacity building between project participants and the broader EIT Urban Mobility community.
profile_positions.title: Researcher CLEAR project

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the supervision of bachelor thesis projects and teaching the second-year bachelor courses "Geographies of Inequality" and “Stadsgeografie”.
profile_positions.title: Junior Teacher

profile_positions.description: Researcher within the ‘Bright future for black towns: reinventing European industrial towns and challenging dominant post-industrial discourses’ project. Primary objective is to develop place-specific strategies for industrial towns in Europe by respecting their strengths, needs and expectations.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Bright Future for Black Towns project

profile_positions.description: VanHooseDotWork is a studio where research and design meet. Projects are concerned with researching and analyzing social and physical processes within the built environment and using design thinking to offer creative strategies and solutions.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description: RUIMTEVOLK is a platform and fast growing network interested in the spatial quality of the Netherlands. Operated by a new generation of driven professionals with diverse backgrounds, we aim to feed spatial professionals with sustainable ideas concerning the spatial development of the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Researcher, designer and consultant

profile_positions.description: One and a half year training program focused on developing consultancy skills.
profile_positions.title: Talent

profile_positions.description: Together with a team of advisers from the consultancy firm Over Morgen, I was responsible for organizing a project concerning the 'DNA' of the four largest cities in the Province of Drenthe. What types of cities are they? What characterizes their residents? What do they have in common and what sets them apart? Qualitative data was collected in the form of interviews and interactive workshops. Quantitative data in the form of maps and figures was also collected in order to provide a complete picture of each city's DNA. This information was used as input for the Omgevingsvisie of the province.
profile_positions.title: External Consultant

profile_positions.description: I was asked by the municipality of Bunnik to develop a new way of working in its spatial planning department. Approach: Following a period of introductory interviews with employees and a review of the current project management style, we developed KinnuB, a tool which brings every aspect of a project into view. In order to make sure the KinnuB model earned a place in the organization, we organized a series of workshops wherein current projects, such as the further development of the recreation area between Bunnik and Utrecht, were used as case studies to gather an integral perspective.
profile_positions.title: External Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Research regarding the relationship between economic competitiveness and metropolitan landscapes across ten international case studies. Research methods include analysis of spatial planning and policy documents, mapping of geo-data and figures using GIS, and conducting semi-structured interviews with policy makers and experts in each region. The results of these international cases are applied to the Dutch context, in an effort to understand how this relationship can serve to strengthen the global competitiveness of the Netherlands.

Alongside the independent research project described above, my role at the Deltametropolis Association included working in a team concerned with developing transit oriented development strategy for the Province of North Holland. Responsibilities included gathering of station data, and creating maps, images and communicative diagrams, which would eventually be adapted in the publication 'Maak Plaats!'.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Independent research project concerning the future role of five peatland areas which are expected to change due to their close proximity to the built-up area of the Randstad. 

I specifically looked at different ways to operationalize and measure the intrinsic, economic and socio-cultural value of these types of landscapes. 

A combination of qualitative and quantitative methods were used including interviews with experts and residents, analysis of policy documents, content analysis and spatial analysis using geometric networks.
profile_positions.title: Intern
